content.raw:
The state.log files are about 80 MB.  Running that through gz unfiltered produces a file around 250 MB.  Compressing to gz results in a final file size around 60 MB.  If I run the state.log through the filter, with 10 Hz sampling, then the file is about 8 MB (vs 250 MB) and compresses to about 3 MB.  Setting the sampling rates to different values changes the file sizes accordingly.  So it is easy to keep the full file and, with compression, be under 100 MB.
The scores are significantly changed by the sampling, more than a second of difference with 10 Hz sampling vs not sampled.  It seems to settle down with sampling rates faster than about 30 Hz.
content.html: The state.log files are about 80 MB. Running that through gz unfiltered produces a file around 250 MB. Compressing to gz results in a final file size around 60 MB. If I run the state.log through the filter, with 10 Hz sampling, then the file is about 8 MB (vs 250 MB) and compresses to about 3 MB. Setting the sampling rates to different values changes the file sizes accordingly. So it is easy to keep the full file and, with compression, be under 100 MB. The scores are significantly changed by the sampling, more than a second of difference with 10 Hz sampling vs not sampled. It seems to settle down with sampling rates faster than about 30 Hz.
